sect1.title: Summary
sect1.para: This chapter offers guidelines for conducting diagnostic interviews for anxiety disorders, using an approach that is consistent with the behavioral approach of functional assessment. Clinicians are implored to rely upon a general model that encompasses anxiety disorders, one that recognizes a stimulus-response component and an operant behavior component in which avoidance behavior is viewed as being negatively reinforced by the removal of threat and/or anxiety. This general model offers a single framework that organizes the diagnostic criteria and symptoms of all of the anxiety disorders. Additionally, this chapter describes many of the nuances in how different anxiety disorders present, the implications of anxiety pathology for conducting diagnostic interviews, and other considerations related to the variability in presentation.
